SENT.plain: Pathological findings are described in four cases of a new aminoaciduria in which homocystine is excreted in the urine
All the patients were mentally retarded children
Three of them presented diagnostic features of Marfan's syndrome
Necropsy on one case and biopsy findings in the others are described
Fatty change occurs in the liver
The most striking lesions are vascular
Metachromatic medial degeneration of the aorta and of the elastic arteries in the necropsied case are considered in relation to Marfan's syndrome
Other changes, particularly thrombosis which is prevalent in homocystinuria, suggest the possibility of a platelet defect
The findings are discussed in respect of an upset in the metabolism of sulphur-containing amino-acids and with particular reference to Marfan's syndrome
